title: Event Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Rice University
Interview Descriptions: This was for the Public Affairs department AND the multicultural center. I learned it was a lot of administrative work. After interviewing I felt overqualified for the position based on my experience with other jobs. They asked some questions that I didn’t feel needed elaboration on such as explaining what calendar coordination is/my familiarity with it. Even after explaining that I’ve done it one of my previous jobs for 10 executives they still wanted me to elaborate more..it was odd to me that they asked how I calendar coordinate. They also asked if I was familiar with graphic designing and website design. not sure why they were pushy with that question because one of the interviewers clarified that they have dedicated team for those things. Asked if I was familiar with Microsoft and Google products, I said yes. They asked me to elaborate. I mentioned Mail merging, cleaning up data in excel. They didn’t seem to understand that.. they asked what mail merging was and what data I’m talking about and where I get it from. Any information that is put into excel is data.. I was also asked about my experience in building relationships with the community. Based on my previous jobs I explained how I build those relationships, etc. but they seemed to downplay a lot of my skills which I didn’t appreciate. One of the panelists also talked a lot so it cut me on time to ask my questions. Also, did not inform me that I didn’t get the job after I sent my thank you email. I personally felt like they wanted someone inexperienced and could maybe have more management over. Not upset that I didn’t get the position because I was planning on saying no. Overall, my interview experience with them was not great. I feel like the panelists kept saying “for the good will” too much as if I didn’t understand what they meant and the mission of the university.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rice University
Interview Descriptions: Applied during school year. Talked with professor and PhD student about my goals. Answers questions regarding prior research experience. The interview was conversational and friendly. The interview process occurred quickly and I heard back for the position soon afterwards.
Interview Questions: What research experience do you have.

title: Information Security Analyst Interview

Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Grader Interview

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview

title: Tour Guide Interview

title: Purchasing Interview

Interview Descriptions: Very wasy and transparent. As soon as i went in the recwprionist was very friendly and gave me necessary paperwork to fill out prior to interview. The whole process was easy. They have a very good environment

title: Intern Interview

title: Graduate Student Interview

title: IT Service Delivery Manager Interview

title: Full-time MBA Interview

title: PhD Student Interview

Interview Descriptions: Admission is based on essays,  resume, transcript; for some departments an interview is required and for others interviews are not required. You also get the chance to visit the university in an accepted students' weekend.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Industry Consultant - Junior Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rice University (San Antonio, TX) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The university conducted a virtual interview by phone.  And a second interview again by phone.  Nothing out of the ordinary although the role description did seem a little less descriptive than what I anticipated.
Interview Questions: I honestly don't recall any specific questions.

title: Director of Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rice University (Houston, TX) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Had one initial phone interview with the Managing Director. I live out of state so they flew me in for an in-person interview. They told me I would have a group interview with the whole team for one hour. The interview ended up lasting three hours and the interviews were split into three separate groups. They asked some gotcha-type questions. Once interview was completed, they said they'd reach out to me in a couple weeks to inform me of their decision. One month later, I received no response. I emailed them and mentioned that I would be able to move to Houston sooner than expected and wanted to check in on the hiring process for this position. No response. Not only do I feel that this is unprofessional behavior, but it is  quite rude to not follow up or respond to applicants, especially after flying 6 hours there and back to apply. I still haven't received the reimbursement for my travels but I'm expecting the check to come in the mail in the coming days.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? How did you find this position?

title: Graduate Researcher Interview

The interview process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates and making a hire

title: Director Interview

title: Research Manager Interview

title: Staff Assistant Interview

After waiting 2 weeks after the interview process, I didn't even get an offer. Very long process. Kind of wasted my time, but the people were nice.
Interview Questions: Why Rice?

title: Systems Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: Overall process took abt 1.5 month.  After u applied, then initial phone interview with hiring manager, if they like you then you go on to take an assessment test.  If you do well on the test then they invite you on campus for a group interview which last abt 3hrs.  You interviewed with other peers in same dept, other peers different department and hiring manager.  After all that I got the standard rejection.  I thought I did well enough but guess that wasn’t enough.  The last panel interview mainly consist of behavioral questions.
Interview Questions:
How you prioritize your tasks?
How you handle stress.

title: Student Club Advisor Interview

Her return has come and gone, I even followed up with an email and still haven't heard anything.

title: Systems Analyst Interview

it was very unorganized and abrupt, like Rice always is
but also very friendly and casual - typical Rice experience
one thing though, even though the process did went on very casual and smooth, it does not mean that you get the offer

E mail Application with resume , technical interview through skype, Research discussion with the professors group regarding the PhD research, Research work presentation in group meeting, Job offer

title: Office Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rice University (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Long interview process. First I had a phone interview, then took a skills test in person, then a panel interview which lasted about 2-3 hours total meeting back to back with different groups. They are also very strict about getting all 3 full references so that adds to the time the process takes. Overall now that I've been working there, I'm surprised they went through all this for the position I'm in. It's a very simple repetitive position that they could really hire a high school student for. I feel like I could do the job with my eyes closed. Not the job for someone with a degree and several years experience.
Interview Questions: Mostly asked general questions about me personally and why I was interested in working there. Also some basic questions about what I did at previous jobs. Despite the long process the interview, the questions aren't structured at all.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rice University (Houston, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied to be a Program Coordinator last year. I first had a phone screening which went very well and was invited to an in person interview the following week. I thought it went very well and everyone in the panel seemed very welcoming to me. However, I was not selected and to be honest, I think it was very rude and inconsiderate of how I was told I would be kept up to date about my status only to log in 3 weeks later  and find out I was not selected via the job portal system. I really think it was due to my racial background that I was not selected because no one in that department looked like me. I have 5 years work experience in an educational setting with a 1 year background working at a University, only  to be told someone with more experience in that particular department was more qualified was very appalling since this job demanded no experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Program Coordinator Interview

Interview Questions: How would I handle multiple members asking for tasks done ASAP?

title: Videographer/Editor Interview

Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview process because it was through a university referral and through emailing and then a 1 on 1 interview in person about a week later. Interview was with future supervisor that asked about experience and skills.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: My potential advisor gave me a phone interview. She asked me some questions related to my research experience in my old university. She also asked me to tell her about what I did in the project, what role did I play, what results did I get. She also told me about the department.
Interview Questions: What role did you play in the Project XXX?

title: Maintenance Interview

Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Program Interview

If you’re super stoked on the school, by all means, express it, but stop short of sucking up. And if you’re not that stoked on the school, but it’s your only option for financial or convenience reasons, you better think of a reason to get excited about it – fast.

title: Marketing Interview

A couple of weeks later, I came into the office and for a face to face interview. The atmosphere was conversational, very comfortable. We went over my resume and what I was looking for and I was asked basic behavioral interview questions. Not intimidating at all.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview

Interview Descriptions: phone interview with the PI of interest, technical questions. Be prepared to answer questions about your phd research in detail. They may be couple behavioral questions and future career plans questions
Interview Questions: usual technical questions about research expertise

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rice University (Houston, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Intensive interview process that included four rounds over a period of 4 weeks: 
(1) Initial Phone Screening
(2) Casual Meeting with Team Members
(3) Formal In-person Panel Interview  (lasting 3 hours, met with a total of 9 people)
(4) Phone Interview with Executive Member

This was one of the most intensive interviews of my life. It seemed that I was interviewing for a C-level position (I was not). I was disappointed not to receive an offer, as I was under the impression that I was the first choice. The position was offered to someone whose education was slightly more in line with the role. I would have preferred to spend a little less time in the interview process, but I also learned quite a bit during each round.
Interview Questions: What is your preferred management style?

title: Research Scientist Interview

Interview Questions: Future areas of research and plans

title: Associate Director Interview

Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Department Coordinator Interview

Interview Descriptions: I received a call from the departments HR, did a phone interview, did an assessment (proofreading, excel, mail merge), interview with group staff, then interviewed with the executive  director.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Why Rice?

title: Research Scientist Interview

Interview Descriptions: The talk went well.  the communication was quite friendly. the campus is beautiful. office people is nice. everything went very well, nothing went wrong. meet with students, faculties. Have lunch and dinner together.
Interview Questions: not difficult

title: Recruiter Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rice University
Interview Descriptions: Called by their HR dept for a phone interview. Phone interview lasted less than 10 mins. All the questions were negative and no amount of practice could of prepared you for this interview. At one point, I heard the interviewer sigh with disapproval when she asked me about the salary (keep in mind the application asked for my salary expectations so I don't understand why it was such a surprise to her). After the interview was done, was told I would hear about the next steps.
Interview Questions: This is exactly the order of negative questions I was asked: 1. Why are you leaving your current employer? 2. Salary expectations 3. Your weakness (never asked about my strengths) 4. Name one thing you don't like about your job and etc.......

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rice University (Houston, TX) in Oct 2014

Interview Questions: What's your background?

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Met with grad student heading project. She asked about my past experience in research and was extremely friendly. She asked about my aspirations and how this position could help me attain that.
Interview Questions: What is your interest in our specific research?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rice University
Interview Descriptions: I had no interview process since I applied for my PhD program online.The online fee was around $100 if my memory is correct. Interview Questions: If the professor's funding is cut, you probably need to find your own financial support. There is no guarantee that you can always receive the financial support until you graduate from the department or your advisor. This situation might make your life more stressful.

title: Graphic Designer Interview

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rice University
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth process, gave great direction and set clear expectations

title: IT Consultant Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Very straightforward. 
A few technical questions to access skill and a few behavioral questions. Job offer was prompt.
Interview Questions: A few questions about networks and equipment

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rice University
Interview Descriptions:
The recruiting/hiring process followed the pretty standard iter of academic jobs, at least in science department.  No surprises.  Being one of the smaller top-tier universities, and being in the Houston, the experience was somewhat less formal than in other places.  The department is smaller than elsewhere, which makes the interview visit less hectic.
Once the interview were over the offer, second visit, and negotiation parts were quite smooth and uneventful, and moving in a timely fashion.
Interview Questions:
We are talking about faculty hires, so most of the interview revolves around research (match, promise, etc...).  It's hard to mention any specific example because the hardest questions tend to be about fairly candidate-specific points.
Overall in faculty hires there is the concern with the likelihood that the candidate will develop a robust (and well funded) research program, attract students, cultivate collaboration opportunities.

title: Summer Counselor Interview

Interview Descriptions: You begin by turning in an application, then you should respond to emails regarding the interview. After setting it up, you should go to the interview, and then wait for an offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you dealt with frustrating circumstances.

title: Tour Guide Interview

Interview Questions: If your group contains students from every division, how do you fit all of their department building locations on the same tour.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: you have the chance to work as a T A when you are a PhD at Rice. you work in the department in which you are a student. There is a process that you get a chance to select which course you want to TA. It's basically an evaluation form which includes instructor and requirement.
Interview Questions: Grading and teaching.

title: Payroll Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions:
The Hiring process was fairly simple, a lot of personality questions.

After applying I received a phone interview from hiring managers and then two weeks later a second interview was requested.  I was in NYC so they arranged a skype interview for me.

The second interview they asked about my job qualifications etc. Very easy overall.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was "How do i deal with office politics"

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rice University (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with them and they promised to let me know the outcome. Unfortunately no one contacted me to at least inform that they are not interested in the second interview. It is a courtesy and I was expecting a better interview experience at Rice.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Rice University in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: A professor called me on my landline. She first introduced herself, then talked about Rice and then her own research. After a nice introduction, she asked me several questions on my bachelor studies and the research I had done so far. From her questions, I understood that she was trying to make sure that I had a clear conception on my research objectives. Later she explained what should I expect during a Ph.D. program at Rice University. The interviewer was nice and thorough.
Interview Questions:
Basic questions on semiconductor physics (since I applied for ECE dept - Nano). 
Some concepts on nanophotonics (that was my intended research area). 
Details about my 4th year project and my publications. Asked technical questions during my explanations.
Future plan and goals.
Why I chose Rice University?

title: Sociology PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Rice University (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very exciting and very enticing. I was extremely pumped up about going to Rice and being a successful PhD student. Unfortunately, there is a bait and switch mentality where they do a lot of work to recruit good students, but in reality, the program is very different from what they say during recruitment. The Sociology program is a mess. If you are a decent student and you have other options for graduate education--take one of those instead. The program is entirely mismanaged, professors frequently leave the country for 6-12 months at a time, and the opportunities to be successful are very different from what they advertise during the February recruitment period. If you are a local Houstonian, and you feel like you can spend about 8+ years dealing with a problematic program, then this place is for you. They mention on their website that it is a five year degree program, but this is entirely inaccurate. They won't let you follow their advertised program of study. RUN.
Interview Questions: The interview phase itself was not difficult. The program itself is, and not in the sense of academically challenging, I mean it in the sense that it is just an awful place with little opportunity.

title: Researcher, TA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rice University (Houston, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview for the science PhD program was over Skype. It was relatively easy. I was asked to describe the courses I took and what I studied. Most students had to travel to Houston for the series of 1:1 interview over 2-3 days. I was allowed to do so remotely, which was a nice but infrequent gesture. Rice faculty is very selective in their students and prefer to meet them in person before giving the final offer.
Interview Questions: I was asked to describe the courses I took and what I studied.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rice University (Houston, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial emails were sent, followed by phone conversation.  The next round was a Skype interview.  After a week, I got the acceptance letter.  It was all very straight forward and very professional.
Interview Questions: What is one strength and weakness of your research question, and how can we assist you?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Rice University (Houston, TX) in Aug 2011

Interview Questions: The questions are about the students interest in research groups. Such as any specific projects they are interested into and what abilities they have which is making the interested.

title: Systems Administrator Interview
